meanings.definition: Relating to or affected with exophthalmos.
meanings.sent1: The exophthalmic patient had bulging eyes.
meanings.sent2: Her exophthalmic condition made her eyes appear larger than usual.
meanings.sent3: The exophthalmic cat looked like it was always surprised.
meanings.sent4: The exophthalmic gaze of the owl seemed to pierce through the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The exophthalmic stare of the portrait gave it an eerie quality.

meanings.definition: Characterized by protrusion of the eyeballs.
meanings.sent1: The exophthalmic dog's eyes seemed to pop out of its head.
meanings.sent2: The exophthalmic frog had eyes that bulged out noticeably.
meanings.sent3: The exophthalmic doll's eyes made it look comically surprised.
meanings.sent4: The exophthalmic headlights of the car illuminated the road ahead.
meanings.sent5: The exophthalmic appearance of the mask gave it a haunting look.

meanings.sent1: The exophthalmic treatment helped reduce the eye protrusion.
meanings.sent2: The exophthalmic surgery aimed to correct the eye bulging.
meanings.sent3: The exophthalmic glasses made him look like a sci-fi character.
meanings.sent4: The exophthalmic effect of the potion made his eyes seem magical.
meanings.sent5: The exophthalmic nature of the condition was evident in her eyes' appearance.
